step.by: submitted by the Chair of the Committee following informal consultations

p.docTitle: Resolutions adopted by the General Assembly on 24 December 2021

p.docProponent: [on the report of the Fifth Committee (A/76/633, para. 60)]

content.p: Appropriations totalling 3,121,651,000 United States dollars are hereby approved for the following purposes:

td.p: Part I. Overall policymaking, direction and coordination
General Assembly and Economic and Social Council affairs and conference management
Part III. International justice and law
Part IV. International cooperation for development
Least developed countries, landlocked developing countries and small island developing States
United Nations support for the New Partnership for Africa’s Development
International drug control, crime and terrorism prevention and criminal justice
Part V. Regional cooperation for development
Economic and social development in Africa
Economic and social development in Asia and the Pacific
Economic and social development in Latin America and the Caribbean
Economic and social development in Western Asia
Part VI. Human rights and humanitarian affairs
International protection, durable solutions and assistance to refugees
Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance
Office of Information and Communications Technology
Part X. Jointly financed administrative activities and special expenses
Construction, alteration, improvement and major maintenance

content.p: The Secretary-General shall be authorized to transfer credits between sections of the budget, with the concurrence of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions;

In addition to the appropriations approved under paragraph 1 above, an amount of 75,000 dollars is appropriated for 2022 from the accumulated income of the Library Endowment Fund for the purchase of books, periodicals, maps and library equipment and for such other expenses of the Library at the Palais des Nations in Geneva as are in accordance with the objects and provisions of the endowment.
Estimates of income totalling 295,499,900 United States dollars are approved as follows:
The income from staff assessment shall be credited to the Tax Equalization Fund in accordance with the provisions of General Assembly resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955;

Direct expenses of the United Nations Postal Administration, services to visitors, the sale of statistical products, catering operations and related services, garage operations, television services and the sale of publications not provided for under the budget appropriations shall be charged against the income derived from those activities.

step.by: submitted by the Chair of the Committee following informal consultations

docTitle.span: Financing of appropriations for the year 2022

intro.p:
Budget appropriations totalling 3,138,294,955 United States dollars, consisting of 3,121,651,000 dollars approved for 2022 by the General Assembly in paragraph 1 of resolution A above, and 16,643,955 dollars in additional appropriations for 2021, as approved by the Assembly in its resolutions 75/253 B of 16 April 2021 and 75/253 C of 30 June 2021, shall be financed in accordance with regulations 3.1 and 3.2 of the Financial Regulations and Rules of the United Nations,
ST/SGB/2013/4 and ST/SGB/2013/4/Amend.1. as follows:

content.p: 16,361,600 dollars, representing the estimated income other than staff assessment income approved for 2022 under resolution B above;

77,094,200 dollars, as reflected in the financial performance report on the programme budget for 2020,
A/76/347. approved by the Assembly in section I of its resolution 76/246 of 24 December 2021;
580,100 dollars credited from the unencumbered balance of the Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of Cambodia in 2020, as approved in section XII of Assembly resolution 76/246;

3,044,259,055 dollars, representing the assessment on Member States in accordance with Assembly resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021 on the scale of assessments for the apportionment of the expenses of the United Nations;

In addition, there shall be added an amount of 107,636,800 dollars, representing the commitment authority relating to special political missions approved by the General Assembly in section X of its resolution 76/246, resulting in a total amount to be assessed of 3,151,895,855 dollars;

There shall be set off against the assessment on Member States, in accordance with the provisions of General Assembly resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund totalling 279,225,500 dollars, consisting of 279,138,300 dollars related to the appropriations for 2022 and 87,200 dollars related to the additional appropriations for 2021, as approved by the Assembly in its resolutions 75/253 B and 75/253 C.
